intro: Neobartsia bartsioides, commonly known as the Ethiopian bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
